get.description: Lists all of the available REST API operations of the Microsoft.Cache provider.

200.description: Success. The response describes the list of operations.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Checks that the redis cache name is valid and is not already in use.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: Parameters supplied to the CheckNameAvailability Redis operation. The only supported resource type is 'Microsoft.Cache/redis'

200.description: Name is available

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Gets any upgrade notifications for a Redis cache.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the Redis cache.

parameters.name: history
parameters.description: how many minutes in past to look for upgrade notifications

200.description: All upgrade notifications in given time range

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

put.description: Create or replace (overwrite/recreate, with potential downtime) an existing Redis cache.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the Redis cache.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: Parameters supplied to the Create Redis operation.

201.description: The new redis cache was successfully created. Check provisioningState to see detailed status.

200.description: The existing redis cache was successfully updated. Check provisioningState to see detailed status.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the Redis cache.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: Parameters supplied to the Update Redis operation.

200.description: The existing redis cache was successfully updated. Check provisioningState to see detailed status.

202.description: The existing redis cache was successfully updated. Check Azure-AsyncOperation headers to poll detailed status.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the Redis cache.

200.description: The redis cache was successfully deleted.

202.description: The redis cache 'delete' operation was successfully enqueued; follow the Location header to poll for final outcome.

204.description: The redis cache was successfully deleted.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the Redis cache.

200.description: The redis cache was successfully found.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Lists all Redis caches in a resource group.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Gets all Redis caches in the specified subscription.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Retrieve a Redis cache's access keys. This operation requires write permission to the cache resource.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the Redis cache.

200.description: Lists the keys for the specified Redis cache.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Regenerate Redis cache's access keys. This operation requires write permission to the cache resource.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the Redis cache.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: Specifies which key to regenerate.

200.description: Lists the regenerated keys for Redis Cache

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Reboot specified Redis node(s). This operation requires write permission to the cache resource. There can be potential data loss.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the Redis cache.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: Specifies which Redis node(s) to reboot.

200.description: Reboot operation successfully enqueued

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the Redis cache.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: Parameters for Redis import operation.

202.description: Import operation successfully enqueued; follow the Location header to poll for final outcome.

200.description: Import operation succeeded.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Export data from the redis cache to blobs in a container.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the Redis cache.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: Parameters for Redis export operation.

202.description: Export operation successfully enqueued; follow the Location header to poll for final outcome.

200.description: Export operation succeeded.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Deletes all of the keys in a cache.

202.description: Flush operation successfully enqueued; follow the Location header to poll for final outcome.

Location.description: URL to query for the status of the operation.

Azure-AsyncOperation.description: URL to query for the status of the operation.

200.description: Flush operation succeeded.

Location.description: URL to query for the status of the operation.

Azure-AsyncOperation.description: URL to query for the status of the operation.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Gets all firewall rules in the specified redis cache.

200.description: Successfully got the current rules

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

put.description: Create or update a redis cache firewall rule

parameters.name: ruleName
parameters.description: The name of the firewall rule.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: Parameters supplied to the create or update redis firewall rule operation.

200.description: Resource was successfully updated

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Gets a single firewall rule in a specified redis cache.

parameters.name: ruleName
parameters.description: The name of the firewall rule.

200.description: Successfully found the rule

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

delete.description: Deletes a single firewall rule in a specified redis cache.

parameters.name: ruleName
parameters.description: The name of the firewall rule.

200.description: Successfully deleted the rule

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Gets all patch schedules in the specified redis cache (there is only one).

200.description: Successfully got the current patch schedules

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

put.description: Create or replace the patching schedule for Redis cache.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the Redis cache.

parameters.name: default
parameters.description: Default string modeled as parameter for auto generation to work correctly.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: Parameters to set the patching schedule for Redis cache.

200.description: The patch schedule was successfully updated.

201.description: The patch schedule was successfully created.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

delete.description: Deletes the patching schedule of a redis cache.

parameters.description: The name of the redis cache.

parameters.name: default
parameters.description: Default string modeled as parameter for auto generation to work correctly.

200.description: Success.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Gets the patching schedule of a redis cache.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the redis cache.

parameters.name: default
parameters.description: Default string modeled as parameter for auto generation to work correctly.

200.description: Response of get patch schedules.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

parameters.description: The name of the linked server that is being added to the Redis cache.

200.description: The linked server was successfully updated.

201.description: The linked server was successfully created.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

parameters.description: The name of the redis cache.

parameters.name: linkedServerName
parameters.description: The name of the linked server that is being added to the Redis cache.

200.description: Linked server was successfully deleted.

202.description: The linked server 'delete' operation was successfully enqueued; follow the Location header to poll for final outcome.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Gets the detailed information about a linked server of a redis cache (requires Premium SKU).

parameters.description: The name of the redis cache.

parameters.name: linkedServerName
parameters.description: The name of the linked server.

200.description: Response of get linked server.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Gets the list of linked servers associated with this redis cache (requires Premium SKU).

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the redis cache.

200.description: Response of get linked servers.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: List all the private endpoint connections associated with the redis cache.

200.description: OK -- Successfully retrieved private endpoint connections.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Gets the specified private endpoint connection associated with the redis cache.

200.description: OK -- Get the private endpoint connection properties successfully.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

put.description: Update the state of specified private endpoint connection associated with the redis cache.

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: The private endpoint connection properties.

200.description: OK -- Update the private endpoint connection properties successfully.

201.description: OK -- Update the private endpoint connection properties successfully.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

delete.description: Deletes the specified private endpoint connection associated with the redis cache.

200.description: OK -- Delete the private endpoint connection successfully.

204.description: No Content -- The private endpoint connection does not exist.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Gets the private link resources that need to be created for a redis cache.

200.description: Successfully retrieved private link resources.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: The location at which operation was triggered

parameters.name: operationId
parameters.description: The ID of asynchronous operation

200.description: Asynchronous operation status response

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

put.description: Adds an access policy to the redis cache

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: Parameters supplied to the Create Update Access Policy operation.

200.description: The existing access policy was successfully updated. Check provisioningState to see detailed status.

201.description: The new access policy was successfully created. Check provisioningState to see detailed status.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

200.description: Successfully deleted the access policy

202.description: The access policy 'delete' operation was successfully enqueued; follow the Location header to poll for final outcome.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

200.description: Response of get access policy.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Gets the list of access policies associated with this redis cache

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: Parameters supplied to the Create Update Access Policy Assignment operation.

200.description: The existing access policy assignment was successfully updated. Check provisioningState to see detailed status.

201.description: The new access policy assignment was successfully created. Check provisioningState to see detailed status.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

CacheNameParameter.name: cacheName
CacheNameParameter.description: The name of the Redis cache.

AccessPolicyNameParameter.name: accessPolicyName
AccessPolicyNameParameter.description: The name of the access policy that is being added to the Redis cache.

AccessPolicyAssignmentNameParameter.name: accessPolicyAssignmentName
AccessPolicyAssignmentNameParameter.description: The name of the access policy assignment.

ApiVersionParameter.name: api-version
ApiVersionParameter.description: The API version to use for this operation.

OperationIdParameter.name: operationId
OperationIdParameter.description: The ID of an ongoing async operation.

ResourceGroupNameParameter.name: resourceGroupName
ResourceGroupNameParameter.description: The name of the resource group. The name is case insensitive.

SubscriptionIdParameter.name: subscriptionId
SubscriptionIdParameter.description: The ID of the target subscription.

PrivateEndpointConnectionName.name: privateEndpointConnectionName
PrivateEndpointConnectionName.description: The name of the private endpoint connection associated with the Azure resource

Sku.description: The resource model definition representing SKU

name.description: The name of the SKU. Ex - P3. It is typically a letter+number code

size.description: The SKU size. When the name field is the combination of tier and some other value, this would be the standalone code.

family.description: If the service has different generations of hardware, for the same SKU, then that can be captured here.

capacity.description: If the SKU supports scale out/in then the capacity integer should be included. If scale out/in is not possible for the resource this may be omitted.

rdb-backup-enabled.description: Specifies whether the rdb backup is enabled

rdb-backup-frequency.description: Specifies the frequency for creating rdb backup in minutes. Valid values: (15, 30, 60, 360, 720, 1440)

rdb-backup-max-snapshot-count.description: Specifies the maximum number of snapshots for rdb backup

rdb-storage-connection-string.description: The storage account connection string for storing rdb file

aof-backup-enabled.description: Specifies whether the aof backup is enabled

maxfragmentationmemory-reserved.description: Value in megabytes reserved for fragmentation per shard

maxmemory-policy.description: The eviction strategy used when your data won't fit within its memory limit.

maxmemory-reserved.description: Value in megabytes reserved for non-cache usage per shard e.g. failover.

maxmemory-delta.description: Value in megabytes reserved for non-cache usage per shard e.g. failover.

notify-keyspace-events.description: The keyspace events which should be monitored.

preferred-data-archive-auth-method.description: Preferred auth method to communicate to storage account used for data archive, specify SAS or ManagedIdentity, default value is SAS

preferred-data-persistence-auth-method.description: Preferred auth method to communicate to storage account used for data persistence, specify SAS or ManagedIdentity, default value is SAS

authnotrequired.description: Specifies whether the authentication is disabled. Setting this property is highly discouraged from security point of view.

storage-subscription-id.description: SubscriptionId of the storage account for persistence (aof/rdb) using ManagedIdentity.

aad-enabled.description: Specifies whether AAD based authentication has been enabled or disabled for the cache

redisConfiguration.description: All Redis Settings. Few possible keys: rdb-backup-enabled,rdb-storage-connection-string,rdb-backup-frequency,maxmemory-delta, maxmemory-policy,notify-keyspace-events, aof-backup-enabled, aof-storage-connection-string-0, aof-storage-connection-string-1 etc.

redisVersion.description: Redis version. This should be in the form 'major[.minor]' (only 'major' is required) or the value 'latest' which refers to the latest stable Redis version that is available. Supported versions: 4.0, 6.0 (latest). Default value is 'latest'.

enableNonSslPort.description: Specifies whether the non-ssl Redis server port (6379) is enabled.

replicasPerMaster.description: The number of replicas to be created per primary.

replicasPerPrimary.description: The number of replicas to be created per primary.

shardCount.description: The number of shards to be created on a Premium Cluster Cache.

minimumTlsVersion.description: Optional: requires clients to use a specified TLS version (or higher) to connect (e,g, '1.0', '1.1', '1.2')

publicNetworkAccess.description: Whether or not public endpoint access is allowed for this cache.  Value is optional but if passed in, must be 'Enabled' or 'Disabled'. If 'Disabled', private endpoints are the exclusive access method. Default value is 'Enabled'

updateChannel.description: Optional: Specifies the update channel for the monthly Redis updates your Redis Cache will receive. Caches using 'Preview' update channel get latest Redis updates at least 4 weeks ahead of 'Stable' channel caches. Default value is 'Stable'.

disableAccessKeyAuthentication.description: Authentication to Redis through access keys is disabled when set as true. Default value is false.

zonalAllocationPolicy.description: Optional: Specifies how availability zones are allocated to the Redis cache. 'Automatic' enables zone redundancy and Azure will automatically select zones based on regional availability and capacity. 'UserDefined' will select availability zones passed in by you using the 'zones' parameter. 'NoZones' will produce a non-zonal cache. If 'zonalAllocationPolicy' is not passed, it will be set to 'UserDefined' when zones are passed in, otherwise, it will be set to 'Automatic' in regions where zones are supported and 'NoZones' in regions where zones are not supported.

RedisCommonProperties.description: Create/Update/Get common properties of the redis cache.

sku.description: The SKU of the Redis cache to deploy.

subnetId.description: The full resource ID of a subnet in a virtual network to deploy the Redis cache in. Example format: /subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/Microsoft.{Network|ClassicNetwork}/VirtualNetworks/vnet1/subnets/subnet1

staticIP.description: Static IP address. Optionally, may be specified when deploying a Redis cache inside an existing Azure Virtual Network; auto assigned by default.

RedisCreateProperties.description: Properties supplied to Create Redis operation.

sku.description: The SKU of the Redis cache to deploy.

RedisUpdateProperties.description: Patchable properties of the redis cache.

accessKeys.description: The keys of the Redis cache - not set if this object is not the response to Create or Update redis cache

linkedServers.description: List of the linked servers associated with the cache

instances.description: List of the Redis instances associated with the cache

privateEndpointConnections.description: List of private endpoint connection associated with the specified redis cache

zones.description: A list of availability zones denoting where the resource needs to come from.

location.description: The geo-location where the resource lives

RedisCreateParameters.description: Parameters supplied to the Create Redis operation.

RedisUpdateParameters.description: Parameters supplied to the Update Redis operation.

primaryKey.description: The current primary key that clients can use to authenticate with Redis cache.

secondaryKey.description: The current secondary key that clients can use to authenticate with Redis cache.

RedisFirewallRule.description: A firewall rule on a redis cache has a name, and describes a contiguous range of IP addresses permitted to connect

RedisFirewallRuleCreateParameters.description: Parameters required for creating a firewall rule on redis cache. (Note, you can just use the FirewallRule type instead now.)

RedisFirewallRuleProperties.description: Specifies a range of IP addresses permitted to connect to the cache

startIP.description: lowest IP address included in the range

endIP.description: highest IP address included in the range

value.description: Results of the list firewall rules operation.

nextLink.description: Link for next page of results.

RedisFirewallRuleListResult.description: The response of list firewall rules Redis operation.

zones.description: A list of availability zones denoting where the resource needs to come from.

RedisResource.description: A single Redis item in List or Get Operation.

nonSslPort.description: If enableNonSslPort is true, provides Redis instance Non-SSL port.

zone.description: If the Cache uses availability zones, specifies availability zone where this instance is located.

shardId.description: If clustering is enabled, the Shard ID of Redis Instance

isMaster.description: Specifies whether the instance is a primary node.

isPrimary.description: Specifies whether the instance is a primary node.

RedisInstanceDetails.description: Details of single instance of redis.

nextLink.description: Link for next page of results.

RedisListResult.description: The response of list Redis operation.

keyType.description: The Redis access key to regenerate.

RedisRegenerateKeyParameters.description: Specifies which Redis access keys to reset.

rebootType.description: Which Redis node(s) to reboot. Depending on this value data loss is possible.

shardId.description: If clustering is enabled, the ID of the shard to be rebooted.

ports.description: A list of redis instances to reboot, specified by per-instance SSL ports or non-SSL ports.

RedisRebootParameters.description: Specifies which Redis node(s) to reboot.

prefix.description: Prefix to use for exported files.

preferred-data-archive-auth-method.description: Preferred auth method to communicate to storage account used for data archive, specify SAS or ManagedIdentity, default value is SAS

storage-subscription-id.description: Subscription id of the storage container for data to be exported using ManagedIdentity.

preferred-data-archive-auth-method.description: Preferred auth method to communicate to storage account used for data archive, specify SAS or ManagedIdentity, default value is SAS

storage-subscription-id.description: Subscription id of the storage container containing files to import using Managed Identity.

dayOfWeek.description: Day of the week when a cache can be patched.

startHourUtc.description: Start hour after which cache patching can start.

maintenanceWindow.description: ISO8601 timespan specifying how much time cache patching can take.

ScheduleEntry.description: Patch schedule entry for a Premium Redis Cache.

scheduleEntries.description: List of patch schedules for a Redis cache.

ScheduleEntries.description: List of patch schedules for a Redis cache.

properties.description: List of patch schedules for a Redis cache.

location.description: The geo-location where the resource lives

RedisPatchSchedule.description: Response to put/get patch schedules for Redis cache.

value.description: Results of the list patch schedules operation.

nextLink.description: Link for next page of results.

RedisPatchScheduleListResult.description: The response of list patch schedules Redis operation.

RedisForceRebootResponse.description: Response to force reboot for Redis cache.

RedisLinkedServerWithProperties.description: Response to put/get linked server (with properties) for Redis cache.

RedisLinkedServerProperties.description: Properties of a linked server to be returned in get/put response

provisioningState.description: Terminal state of the link between primary and secondary redis cache.

value.description: List of linked servers (with properties) of a Redis cache.

RedisLinkedServerWithPropertiesList.description: List of linked servers (with properties) of a Redis cache.

RedisLinkedServerCreateProperties.description: Create properties for a linked server

linkedRedisCacheId.description: Fully qualified resourceId of the linked redis cache.

linkedRedisCacheLocation.description: Location of the linked redis cache.

geoReplicatedPrimaryHostName.description: The unchanging DNS name which will always point to current geo-primary cache among the linked redis caches for seamless Geo Failover experience.

primaryHostName.description: The changing DNS name that resolves to the current geo-primary cache among the linked redis caches before or after the Geo Failover.

properties.description: Properties required to create a linked server.

RedisLinkedServerCreateParameters.description: Parameter required for creating a linked server to redis cache.

permissions.description: Permissions for the access policy. Learn how to configure permissions at https://aka.ms/redis/AADPreRequisites

RedisCacheAccessPolicyProperties.description: All properties of an access policy.

value.description: List of access policies (with properties) of a Redis cache.

RedisCacheAccessPolicyList.description: List of access policies (with properties) of a Redis cache.

RedisCacheAccessPolicyAssignmentProperti.description: Properties for an access policy assignment

provisioningState.description: Provisioning state of an access policy assignment set

objectId.description: Object Id to assign access policy to

objectIdAlias.description: User friendly name for object id. Also represents username for token based authentication

accessPolicyName.description: The name of the access policy that is being assigned

properties.description: Properties of an access policy assignment

RedisCacheAccessPolicyAssignment.description: Response to an operation on access policy assignment

value.description: List of access policies assignments (with properties) of a Redis cache.

RedisCacheAccessPolicyAssignmentList.description: List of access policies assignments (with properties) of a Redis cache.

Operation.title: REST API Operation
Operation.description: Details of a REST API operation, returned from the Resource Provider Operations API

name.description: The name of the operation, as per Resource-Based Access Control (RBAC). Examples: "Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines/write", "Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines/capture/action"

isDataAction.description: Whether the operation applies to data-plane. This is "true" for data-plane operations and "false" for ARM/control-plane operations.

display.description: Localized display information for this particular operation.

provider.description: The localized friendly form of the resource provider name, e.g. "Microsoft Monitoring Insights" or "Microsoft Compute".

resource.description: The localized friendly name of the resource type related to this operation. E.g. "Virtual Machines" or "Job Schedule Collections".

operation.description: The concise, localized friendly name for the operation; suitable for dropdowns. E.g. "Create or Update Virtual Machine", "Restart Virtual Machine".

description.description: The short, localized friendly description of the operation; suitable for tool tips and detailed views.

origin.description: The intended executor of the operation; as in Resource Based Access Control (RBAC) and audit logs UX. Default value is "user,system"

actionType.description: Enum. Indicates the action type. "Internal" refers to actions that are for internal only APIs.

OperationListResult.description: A list of REST API operations supported by an Azure Resource Provider. It contains an URL link to get the next set of results.

value.description: List of operations supported by the resource provider

nextLink.description: URL to get the next set of operation list results (if there are any).

CheckNameAvailabilityParameters.description: Parameters body to pass for resource name availability check.

type.description: Resource type. The only legal value of this property for checking redis cache name availability is 'Microsoft.Cache/redis'.

nextLink.description: Link for next set of notifications.

properties.description: Additional properties from RP, only when operation is successful

AzureEntityResource.title: Entity Resource
AzureEntityResource.description: The resource model definition for an Azure Resource Manager resource with an etag.

name.description: The name of the resource for which availability needs to be checked.

nameAvailable.description: Indicates if the resource name is available.

reason.description: The reason why the given name is not available.

message.description: Detailed reason why the given name is available.

ErrorAdditionalInfo.description: The resource management error additional info.

ErrorResponse.title: Error response
ErrorResponse.description: Common error response for all Azure Resource Manager APIs to return error details for failed operations. (This also follows the OData error response format.).

principalId.description: The principal ID of resource identity.

keyIdentifier.description: Key vault uri to access the encryption key.

identity.description: The client ID of the identity which will be used to access key vault.

OperationStatusResult.description: The current status of an async operation.

id.description: Fully qualified ID for the async operation.

percentComplete.description: Percent of the operation that is complete.

startTime.description: The start time of the operation.

endTime.description: The end time of the operation.

error.description: If present, details of the operation error.

name.description: A user defined name of the 3rd Party Artifact that is being procured.

publisher.description: The publisher of the 3rd Party Artifact that is being bought. E.g. NewRelic

product.description: The 3rd Party artifact that is being procured. E.g. NewRelic. Product maps to the OfferID specified for the artifact at the time of Data Market onboarding.

promotionCode.description: A publisher provided promotion code as provisioned in Data Market for the said product/artifact.

version.description: The version of the desired product/artifact.

ProxyResource.title: Proxy Resource
ProxyResource.description: The resource model definition for a Azure Resource Manager proxy resource. It will not have tags and a location

Resource.title: Resource
Resource.description: Common fields that are returned in the response for all Azure Resource Manager resources

id.description: Fully qualified resource ID for the resource. Ex - /subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/{resourceProviderNamespace}/{resourceType}/{resourceName}

type.description: The type of the resource. E.g. "Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines" or "Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts"

systemData.description: Azure Resource Manager metadata containing createdBy and modifiedBy information.

ResourceModelWithAllowedPropertySet.description: The resource model definition containing the full set of allowed properties for a resource. Except properties bag, there cannot be a top level property outside of this set.

managedBy.description: The fully qualified resource ID of the resource that manages this resource. Indicates if this resource is managed by another Azure resource. If this is present, complete mode deployment will not delete the resource if it is removed from the template since it is managed by another resource.

kind.description: Metadata used by portal/tooling/etc to render different UX experiences for resources of the same type; e.g. ApiApps are a kind of Microsoft.Web/sites type.  If supported, the resource provider must validate and persist this value.

etag.description: The etag field is *not* required. If it is provided in the response body, it must also be provided as a header per the normal etag convention.  Entity tags are used for comparing two or more entities from the same requested resource. HTTP/1.1 uses entity tags in the etag (section 14.19), If-Match (section 14.24), If-None-Match (section 14.26), and If-Range (section 14.27) header fields.

SkuTier.description: This field is required to be implemented by the Resource Provider if the service has more than one tier, but is not required on a PUT.

TrackedResource.title: Tracked Resource
TrackedResource.description: The resource model definition for an Azure Resource Manager tracked top level resource which has 'tags' and a 'location'

location.description: The geo-location where the resource lives

encryptionProperties.description: Configuration of key for data encryption

status.description: Indicates whether or not the encryption is enabled for container registry.

locationData.description: Metadata pertaining to the geographic location of the resource.

name.description: A canonical name for the geographic or physical location.

city.description: The city or locality where the resource is located.

district.description: The district, state, or province where the resource is located.

countryOrRegion.description: The country or region where the resource is located

systemData.description: Metadata pertaining to creation and last modification of the resource.

createdBy.description: The identity that created the resource.

createdByType.description: The type of identity that created the resource.

lastModifiedBy.description: The identity that last modified the resource.

lastModifiedByType.description: The type of identity that last modified the resource.

lastModifiedAt.description: The timestamp of resource last modification (UTC)

id.description: The ARM identifier for Private Endpoint

privateEndpoint.description: The resource of private end point.
